title: Launcher Black screen
body:
So as per usual I start up league of legends. It said something about having problems with direct x.
So I updated Direct X and adobe air, and even uninstalled League and re downloaded it.
I still have the black screen issue and don't know what to do about it.


Edit: I also have waited about 30 minutes with no change to the screen at all.

Thanks

6xb

replies.body:
Try the following:

Open up your internet options, reset it to default, and then set security level to medium-low. If that doesn't work, run the patcher in admin mode.

Best of luck.

I tried it but it didn't work.

Thanks for trying to help though :)

But wait, there's more:

Try updating your computer and making sure you have the latest graphics drivers installed. If that still doesn't work, try changing your [DNS to Google's Public](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4) one.

Are there any new fixes for the Windows 10, launch screen problem? I could initially play when I got W.10  but now for some reason I can't :( Must have been a PC update that doesn't like  LoL. 24 days since my last game.. Send help. R.I.P Me
I've tried all those steps and it failed but thanks for taking your time to try and help :)

It ain't over yet.

Disable all anti-viruses and firewalls you may have. Remember, many computers will often have more than one installed and running at the same time, so double check for that.

If you're running an earlier version of Windows (ie. Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP), you can [try turning off IPv6](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3).

If you're on Windows 8, you might wanna turn off your TCP delay. Not too sure how to do it, but I'll look it up if you want me to.

Best of luck.
im on windows 8 and i dont know how to turn off  the tcp delay thing plz help me

I got a notification that you replied here but there doesn't seem to be a message.

Could you explain what happened? How did you go with disabling your TCP delay?

Righteo.


    1. From a command prompt (Winkey + R) run “regedit”.
    2. Browse to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces.
    3. Browse the items under interfaces until you find one that has an IPAddress entry matching the network interface you want to affect (typically LAN IP addresses start with 192.168 or 10.0); note that if your IP address is automatically assigned by a DHCP server you may need to look for a matching DhcpIPAddress instead of IPAddress. [This page](http://www.whatismyip.com/) will tell you your current global IP address if you need to be sure.
    4. Right-click on the interface and select New > DWORD (32-bit) Value, name it “TcpAckFrequency”.
    5. Right-click the new TcpAckFrequency value and select Modify, enter “1″ (Hexadecimal radio button should be selected).
    6. Right-click on the interface and select New > DWORD (32-bit) Value, name it “TCPNoDelay” (note that TCP is all uppercase this time – that’s intentional).
    7. Right-click the new TCPNoDelay value and select Modify, enter “1″ (Hexadecimal radio button should be selected).
    8. Verify that both TcpAckFrequency and TCPNoDelay now show up in the adapter’s property list with types REG_DWORD and values 0×00000001.
    9. Exit regedit and reboot (reboot is necessary for the changes to take effect!)

Shamelessly ripped and edited off of [this page](http://web.archive.org/web/20131204131108/http://lifeandcode.net/2009/05/reduce-game-network-latency-in-windows-7-or-vista/comment-page-1). It says it applies to Win 7 and Vista, but they use the same way of configuration down in registry level.
